Nib
  • Nib  
  • nib  
  • nib package  
  • nib.core package

nib.core package

Nib core functionality for application lifecycle and system integration.

This module provides the core classes and functions for creating and running Nib menu bar applications.

Classes:

App - Main application class managing lifecycle and UI SFSymbol - SF Symbol (Apple system icon) view MenuItem - Menu item for right-click context menus MenuDivider - Separator for context menus State - Reactive state descriptor for class-based apps Binding - Two-way binding for state values Connection - Unix socket connection to Swift runtime UserDefaults - Persistent key-value storage

Functions:

run() - Entry point for function-based applications

Example

Function-based app (recommended):

import nib

def main(app: nib.App):
    app.title = "My App"
    app.icon = nib.SFSymbol("star.fill")
    app.build(nib.Text("Hello!"))

nib.run(main)

Class-based app:

import nib

class MyApp(nib.App):
    def body(self):
        return nib.Text("Hello!")

MyApp(icon="star.fill").run()
class nib.core.App(title=None, icon=None)[source]

Bases: object

Main application class for Nib menu bar applications.

The App class manages the entire lifecycle of a Nib application, including:

  • Window configuration (size, title, icon)

  • View tree rendering and updates

  • Event handling (taps, changes, hotkeys)

  • System integration (notifications, clipboard, file dialogs)

  • Communication with the Swift runtime

title

The title displayed in the menu bar (optional).

icon

The menu bar icon as string or SFSymbol.

width

The popover window width in points.

height

The popover window height in points.

menu

List of MenuItem for right-click context menu.

fonts

Dictionary mapping font names to file paths/URLs.

on_appear

Callback invoked when the popover opens.

Example

Function-based (recommended):

def main(app: nib.App):
    app.title = "My App"
    app.icon = nib.SFSymbol("star.fill")
    app.width = 300
    app.height = 200

    app.build(nib.Text("Hello!"))

nib.run(main)

Class-based:

class MyApp(nib.App):
    def body(self) -> nib.View:
        return nib.Text("Hello!")

MyApp(icon="star.fill").run()
Parameters:

  • title (Optional[str])

  • icon (Union[str, SFSymbol, None])

classmethod set_assets_dir(path)[source]

Set the assets directory for the application.

Parameters:

path (Union[str, Path, None]) Path to assets directory, or None to auto-detect.

Return type:

None

classmethod resolve_asset(relative_path)[source]

Resolve an asset path to an absolute path.

Parameters:

relative_path (str) Path relative to assets directory, or absolute/URL.

Return type:

str

Returns:

Resolved absolute path, or original path if not found in assets.

__init__(title=None, icon=None)[source]
Parameters:

  • title (Optional[str])

  • icon (Union[str, SFSymbol, None])

property fonts: Dict[str, str]

Get the registered custom fonts.

Returns:

Dictionary mapping font names to their paths/URLs.

property on_appear: Callable[[], None] | None

Get the on_appear callback.

property title: str | None

Get the app title.

property icon: str | SFSymbol | None

Get the app icon.

property show_quit_item: bool

Get whether the quit item is shown.

property width: float | None

Get the app window width.

property height: float | None

Get the app window height.

property menu: List[MenuItem]

Get the right-click menu items.

property clipboard: str

Get clipboard content (blocking). Note: For async usage, use get_clipboard() with a callback.

get_clipboard(callback)[source]

Get clipboard content asynchronously.

Parameters:

callback (Callable[[str], None]) Function called with the clipboard content.

Return type:

None

set_clipboard(content)[source]

Set clipboard content.

Parameters:

content (str)

Return type:

None

on_hotkey(shortcut, callback)[source]

Register a global keyboard shortcut.

Parameters:

  • shortcut (str) Key combination like cmd+shift+n, cmd+k

  • callback (Callable[[], None]) Function to call when hotkey is pressed.

Return type:

None

Example

app.on_hotkey(cmd+shift+n, show_window)

hotkey(shortcut)[source]

Decorator to register a global keyboard shortcut.

Example

@app.hotkey(cmd+shift+n) def show_window():

pass

Parameters:

shortcut (str)

Return type:

Callable

open_file_dialog(callback, title=None, types=None, multiple=False, directory=None)[source]

Show an open file dialog.

Parameters:

  • callback (Callable[[List[str]], None]) Called with list of selected file paths (empty if cancelled).

  • title (Optional[str]) Dialog title.

  • types (Optional[List[str]]) Allowed file extensions (e.g., [txt, md]).

  • multiple (bool) Allow selecting multiple files.

  • directory (Optional[str]) Starting directory.

Return type:

None

save_file_dialog(callback, title=None, types=None, default_name=None, directory=None)[source]

Show a save file dialog.

Parameters:

  • callback (Callable[[str], None]) Called with selected file path (empty if cancelled).

  • title (Optional[str]) Dialog title.

  • types (Optional[List[str]]) Allowed file extensions.

  • default_name (Optional[str]) Default filename.

  • directory (Optional[str]) Starting directory.

Return type:

None

quit()[source]

Quit the application.

Return type:

None

notify(title, body=None, subtitle=None, sound=True, identifier=None)[source]

Send a macOS system notification.

Parameters:

  • title (str) The notification title (required).

  • body (Optional[str]) The notification body text.

  • subtitle (Optional[str]) A subtitle shown below the title.

  • sound (bool) Whether to play the default notification sound (default: True).

  • identifier (Optional[str]) A unique identifier for this notification. Can be used to update or remove the notification later.

Return type:

None

Example

app.notify(Download Complete, Your file has been saved)

app.notify(

title=New Message, body=You have a new message from John, subtitle=Messages, sound=True,

)

build(view)[source]

Set the root view of the app and trigger a rerender if running.

Parameters:

view (View) The root view to display.

Return type:

None

body()[source]

Define the UI of your app. Override this method in subclass, or use build() in function-based style.

Return type:

View

Returns:

The root view of your application.

run()[source]

Run the application.

Return type:

None

class nib.core.SFSymbol(name, weight=None, scale=None, rendering_mode=None, width=None, height=None, padding=None, foreground_color=None, background=None, opacity=None, font=None, font_weight=None, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: View

A view that displays an SF Symbol (Apple system icon).

Usage:

app.icon = nib.SFSymbol(pencil.and.outline)

nib.Button(content=nib.SFSymbol(star.fill), action=on_click)

nib.HStack(controls=[

nib.SFSymbol(star, foreground_color=nib.Color.yellow), nib.Text(Favorites),

])

# With symbol configuration nib.SFSymbol(

heart.fill, weight=bold, scale=large, rendering_mode=hierarchical, foreground_color=nib.Color.red,

)

Parameters:

  • name (str)

  • weight (Optional[str])

  • scale (Optional[str])

  • rendering_mode (Union[SymbolRenderingMode, str, None])

  • width (Optional[float])

  • height (Optional[float])

  • padding (Union[float, dict, None])

  • foreground_color (Optional[str])

  • background (Optional[str])

  • opacity (Optional[float])

  • font (Optional[str])

  • font_weight (Optional[str])

Create an SF Symbol view.

Parameters:

  • name (str) The SF Symbol name (e.g., star.fill, gear)

  • weight (Optional[str]) Symbol weight (ultralight, thin, light, regular, medium, semibold, bold, heavy, black)

  • scale (Optional[str]) Symbol scale (small, medium, large)

  • rendering_mode (Union[SymbolRenderingMode, str, None]) Rendering mode (SymbolRenderingMode enum or string: monochrome, hierarchical, palette, multicolor)

  • width (Optional[float])

  • height (Optional[float])

  • padding (Union[float, dict, None])

  • foreground_color (Optional[str])

  • background (Optional[str])

  • opacity (Optional[float])

  • font (Optional[str])

  • font_weight (Optional[str])

Create an SF Symbol view.

Parameters:

  • weight (Optional[str]) Symbol weight (ultralight, thin, light, regular, medium, semibold, bold, heavy, black)

  • scale (Optional[str]) Symbol scale (small, medium, large)

  • rendering_mode (Union[SymbolRenderingMode, str, None]) Rendering mode (SymbolRenderingMode enum or string: monochrome, hierarchical, palette, multicolor)

  • height (Optional[float])

nib.core.run(main, assets_dir=None)[source]

Run a Nib application with a function-based entry point.

This is the recommended way to create Nib apps:

import nib

def main(app: nib.App):

app.title = My App app.icon = nib.SFSymbol(star.fill)

counter = nib.TextField(value=0)

def increment(e):

counter.value = str(int(counter.value) + 1)

app.build(
nib.HStack(controls=[

counter, nib.Button(content=nib.Text(+), action=increment),

])

)

nib.run(main)

# Or with custom assets directory: nib.run(main, assets_dir=my_assets)

Parameters:

  • main (Callable[[App], None]) A function that receives an App instance and configures it.

  • assets_dir (Union[str, Path, None]) Path to assets directory (default: auto-detect assets folder).

Return type:

None

class nib.core.MenuItem(title, action=None, icon=None, menu=None, shortcut=None, state=None, badge=None, enabled=True)[source]

Bases: object

A menu item for the right-click context menu.

Supports nested submenus, keyboard shortcuts, badges, and state indicators.

Parameters:

  • title (str) The menu item text.

  • action (Optional[Callable[[], None]]) Callback when item is clicked.

  • icon (Union[str, SFSymbol, None]) SF Symbol name (str) or SFSymbol view with configuration.

  • menu (Optional[List[MenuItem]]) List of child MenuItems for submenus.

  • shortcut (Optional[str]) Keyboard shortcut (e.g., cmd+q, cmd+shift+n, opt+x).

  • state (Optional[str]) Checkmark state - on (checkmark), off (none), or mixed (dash).

  • badge (Optional[str]) Badge text shown on the right (macOS 14+).

  • enabled (bool) Whether the item is clickable (default True).

Usage:
app.menu = [

# Simple string icon nib.MenuItem(Settings, action=open_settings, icon=gear, shortcut=cmd+,),

# SFSymbol with configuration nib.MenuItem(

Favorites, action=show_favorites, icon=nib.SFSymbol(star.fill, weight=bold, foreground_color=#FFD700),

),

nib.MenuItem(Check for Updates, action=check_updates), nib.MenuItem(Dark Mode, action=toggle_dark, state=on), nib.MenuItem(Downloads, badge=3), nib.MenuItem(

More Options, icon=ellipsis.circle, menu=[

nib.MenuItem(Option A, action=option_a, shortcut=cmd+1), nib.MenuItem(Option B, action=option_b, shortcut=cmd+2),

],

), nib.MenuDivider(), nib.MenuItem(Quit, action=app.quit, shortcut=cmd+q),

]

class nib.core.State(initial)[source]

Bases: Generic[T]

Reactive state descriptor that triggers re-renders when modified.

A Python descriptor that stores state per-instance and automatically calls the owners _trigger_rerender() method when the value changes.

This is primarily used for class-based App definitions. For function-based apps, use direct property mutation on views instead.

_initial

The initial/default value for this state.

_name

The mangled attribute name used for storage.

Example

Using State in a class-based App:

class MyApp(nib.App):
    name = nib.State("")
    count = nib.State(0)
    enabled = nib.State(True)

    def body(self):
        return nib.VStack(controls=[
            nib.Text(f"Hello, {self.name}!"),
            nib.Text(f"Count: {self.count}"),
            nib.Toggle(is_on=self.enabled),
        ])

    def increment(self):
        self.count += 1  # Triggers re-render

Note

The state value is stored in a mangled attribute on the instance (e.g., _state_count) to avoid conflicts with other attributes.

Parameters:

initial (TypeVar(T))

Initialize a State descriptor with a default value.

Parameters:

initial (TypeVar(T)) The initial value for this state variable.

__init__(initial)[source]

Initialize a State descriptor with a default value.

Parameters:

initial (TypeVar(T)) The initial value for this state variable.

__set_name__(owner, name)[source]

Called when the descriptor is assigned to a class attribute.

Parameters:

  • owner (type) The class that owns this descriptor.

  • name (str) The attribute name this descriptor is assigned to.

Return type:

None

__get__(obj, objtype=None)[source]

Get the current state value.

Parameters:

  • obj (Any) The instance to get the value from.

  • objtype (Optional[type]) The owner class type.

Return type:

TypeVar(T)

Returns:

The current state value, or the descriptor itself if accessed from the class (not an instance).

__set__(obj, value)[source]

Set the state value and trigger a re-render if changed.

Parameters:

  • obj (Any) The instance to set the value on.

  • value (TypeVar(T)) The new value to set.

Return type:

None

class nib.core.Binding(getter, setter)[source]

Bases: Generic[T]

Two-way binding to a state value.

A Binding wraps getter and setter functions to provide bidirectional data flow between a state variable and a UI control.

This is useful for controls like TextField where the control needs to both read the current value and write changes back to state.

_getter

Function that returns the current value.

_setter

Function that updates the value.

Example

Creating a binding to an app state:

class MyApp(nib.App):
    name = nib.State("")

    def body(self):
        return nib.TextField(
            text=Binding(
                getter=lambda: self.name,
                setter=lambda v: setattr(self, "name", v),
            )
        )

Note

For most use cases, the function-based approach with on_change callbacks is simpler and more explicit.

Parameters:

  • getter (Callable[[], TypeVar(T)])

  • setter (Callable[[TypeVar(T)], None])

Initialize a two-way binding.

Parameters:

  • getter (Callable[[], TypeVar(T)]) Function that returns the current value.

  • setter (Callable[[TypeVar(T)], None]) Function that updates the value.

__init__(getter, setter)[source]

Initialize a two-way binding.

Parameters:

  • getter (Callable[[], TypeVar(T)]) Function that returns the current value.

  • setter (Callable[[TypeVar(T)], None]) Function that updates the value.

property value: T

Get the current bound value.

Returns:

The current value from the getter function.

class nib.core.Connection(socket_path)[source]

Bases: object

Unix socket connection to the Swift runtime.

Manages bidirectional communication with the nib-runtime Swift process using length-prefixed MessagePack messages over a Unix domain socket.

Messages are sent with a 4-byte big-endian length prefix followed by the MessagePack-encoded payload. Events from Swift are received on a background thread and dispatched to a registered handler.

socket_path

Path to the Unix domain socket.

Example

Internal usage by App:

conn = Connection("/tmp/nib-12345.sock")
if conn.connect():
    conn.set_event_handler(handle_event)
    conn.send_render(root=view_tree)
    # ... later ...
    conn.send_quit()
    conn.disconnect()
Parameters:

socket_path (str)

Initialize a new Connection.

Parameters:

socket_path (str) Path to the Unix domain socket file.

__init__(socket_path)[source]

Initialize a new Connection.

Parameters:

socket_path (str) Path to the Unix domain socket file.

connect(retries=10, delay=0.2)[source]

Connect to the Swift runtime socket.

Attempts to connect to the Unix socket with retries, as the Swift runtime may take time to start and create the socket.

Parameters:

  • retries (int) Maximum number of connection attempts.

  • delay (float) Seconds to wait between retry attempts.

Return type:

bool

Returns:

True if connection succeeded, False otherwise.

disconnect()[source]

Disconnect from the Swift runtime.

Closes the socket connection and stops the read thread. Safe to call multiple times.

Return type:

None

send_render(root, icon=None, title=None, width=None, height=None, menu=None, hotkeys=None, fonts=None)[source]

Send a full render message to the Swift runtime.

This sends the complete view tree and app configuration to Swift for rendering. Used for initial render or when incremental patching would be too complex.

Parameters:

  • root (Optional[dict]) Serialized view tree dictionary.

  • icon (Optional[str]) Menu bar icon (SF Symbol name or config dict).

  • title (Optional[str]) Menu bar title text.

  • width (Optional[float]) Popover window width in points.

  • height (Optional[float]) Popover window height in points.

  • menu (Optional[list]) List of serialized menu item dictionaries.

  • hotkeys (Optional[list]) List of hotkey strings to register.

  • fonts (Optional[dict]) Dictionary mapping font names to paths/URLs.

Return type:

None

send_patch(patches, icon=None, title=None, width=None, height=None)[source]

Send incremental patches to the Swift runtime.

Instead of re-rendering the entire view tree, this sends only the changes (patches) needed to update the UI.

Note

Currently disabled in favor of full renders due to Swift-side handling issues.

Parameters:

  • patches (list) List of patch operations from diff_trees().

  • icon (Optional[str]) Menu bar icon (SF Symbol name or config dict).

  • title (Optional[str]) Menu bar title text.

  • width (Optional[float]) Popover window width in points.

  • height (Optional[float]) Popover window height in points.

Return type:

None

send_quit()[source]

Send a quit message to terminate the Swift runtime.

Return type:

None

send_notify(title, body=None, subtitle=None, sound=True, identifier=None)[source]

Send a macOS notification through the Swift runtime.

Parameters:

  • title (str) The notification title (required).

  • body (Optional[str]) The notification body text.

  • subtitle (Optional[str]) A subtitle shown below the title.

  • sound (bool) Whether to play the default notification sound.

  • identifier (Optional[str]) Unique ID for updating/removing the notification.

send_clipboard_read(request_id)[source]

Request clipboard content asynchronously.

The clipboard content will be returned via an event callback with the format clipboard:<content>.

Parameters:

request_id (str) Unique ID to match the response callback.

Return type:

None

send_file_dialog(action, request_id, title=None, types=None, multiple=False, directory=None, default_name=None)[source]

Show a file open or save dialog.

The selected file path(s) will be returned via an event callback with the format fileDialog:<paths>.

Parameters:

  • action (str) Either open or save.

  • request_id (str) Unique ID to match the response callback.

  • title (Optional[str]) Dialog window title.

  • types (Optional[list]) Allowed file extensions (e.g., [txt, md]).

  • multiple (bool) Allow selecting multiple files (open only).

  • directory (Optional[str]) Starting directory path.

  • default_name (Optional[str]) Default filename (save only).

Return type:

None

send_user_defaults(action, key=None, value=None, prefix=None, request_id=None)[source]

Send a UserDefaults operation to the Swift runtime.

Parameters:

  • action (str) Operation type - set, get, remove, clear, containsKey, or getKeys.

  • key (Optional[str]) The key for get/set/remove/containsKey operations.

  • value (Any) The value to store (set operation only).

  • prefix (Optional[str]) Key prefix filter (getKeys operation only).

  • request_id (Optional[str]) Unique ID for async response matching.

Return type:

None

set_event_handler(handler)[source]

Set the handler for events from the Swift runtime.

Parameters:

handler (Callable[[str, str], None]) Callback function receiving (node_id, event_string). The event string format varies by event type: - tap - User tapped a button - change:<value> - Value changed (TextField, Toggle, etc.) - hotkey:<shortcut> - Global hotkey pressed - drop:<paths> - Files dropped on a view - clipboard:<content> - Clipboard read response - fileDialog:<paths> - File dialog response

Return type:

None

class nib.core.UserDefaults(app=None)[source]

Bases: object

Service that provides access to persistent key-value storage.

Uses macOS UserDefaults under the hood for persistence.

Usage:

# Set a value nib.UserDefaults().set(my_key, my_value) nib.UserDefaults().set(count, 42) nib.UserDefaults().set(enabled, True)

# Get a value (blocking) value = nib.UserDefaults().get(my_key) print(fGot: {value})

# Check if key exists exists = nib.UserDefaults().contains_key(my_key)

# Get all keys with prefix keys = nib.UserDefaults().get_keys(settings.)

# Remove a key nib.UserDefaults().remove(my_key)

# Clear all keys nib.UserDefaults().clear()

Parameters:

app (Optional[App])

Create a UserDefaults service.

Parameters:

app (Optional[App]) Optional App instance. If not provided, uses the current running app.

__init__(app=None)[source]

Create a UserDefaults service.

Parameters:

app (Optional[App]) Optional App instance. If not provided, uses the current running app.

set(key, value)[source]

Sets a value for the given key.

Parameters:

  • key (str) The key to store the value under.

  • value (Any) The value to store. Supports strings, numbers, booleans, lists, and dictionaries.

Return type:

None

Example

nib.UserDefaults().set(username, john) nib.UserDefaults().set(score, 100) nib.UserDefaults().set(dark_mode, True)

get(key, default=None, timeout=5.0)[source]

Gets the value for the given key.

Parameters:

  • key (str) The key to retrieve.

  • default (Any) Default value if key not found (default: None).

  • timeout (float) Max time to wait for response in seconds (default: 5.0).

Return type:

Any

Returns:

The stored value, or default if not found.

Example

username = nib.UserDefaults().get(username) score = nib.UserDefaults().get(score, default=0)

remove(key)[source]

Removes the value for the given key.

Parameters:

key (str) The key to remove.

Return type:

None

Example

nib.UserDefaults().remove(old_setting)

clear()[source]

Clears all keys and values. :rtype: None

Example

nib.UserDefaults().clear()

contains_key(key, timeout=5.0)[source]

Checks if the given key exists.

Parameters:

  • key (str) The key to check.

  • timeout (float) Max time to wait for response in seconds (default: 5.0).

Return type:

bool

Returns:

True if key exists, False otherwise.

Example

if nib.UserDefaults().contains_key(api_key):

print(API key is set)

get_keys(prefix='', timeout=5.0)[source]

Gets all keys with the given prefix.

Parameters:

  • prefix (str) Filter keys by this prefix (default: for all keys).

  • timeout (float) Max time to wait for response in seconds (default: 5.0).

Return type:

List[str]

Returns:

List of matching keys.

Example

# Get all keys starting with user. keys = nib.UserDefaults().get_keys(user.)

# Get all keys all_keys = nib.UserDefaults().get_keys()
